sections.title: Welcome
sections.content:
Thanks for purchasing No Title. Why is the theme called No Title? Because I’m terrible at naming products and I wanted to get this theme to you guys and gals as soon as possible. I hope that you find this theme to be everything you hoped for and more. If you have any questions contact me here: brettmcdade@gmail.com.

I would love to see what you create with this theme. Feel free to share your work with me.

sections.title: Installing Template
sections.content:
Unzip the downloaded theme and you’ll find three themes with all the files you’ll need to make magic.

You can view the templates in any browser without an internet connection but there are a couple things that will not work without an internet connection.

  • Audio
  • Contact Form
  • Newsletter Signup Form
  • Video

To place these files online, select all of the files in one of the Template Folders, open up a FTP client (such as FileZilla) and upload the content of the Template Folder on your server root.

Once the files are done uploading you can view the Template online at www.yourdomain.com/index.html.

sections.title: HTML Structure
sections.content:
This Template is responsive and built loosely on top of a 12 column grid. In order to keep the theme as lean as possible we did not set out to develop on top of some massive framework. We wanted to keep this thing as modular and adaptive to your needs as possible.

The closest we get to any kind of grid system is implementing simple 2, 3, or 4 column blocks. If you need to put content into 2, 3, or 4 columns here is some sample code for you:

 

2 columns 

<div class="grid grid--1to2">
  <div class="grid__column”>
    <!— content goes here —>
  </div>
  <div class="grid__column”>
    <!— content goes here —>
  </div>
</div>

 

3 columns 

<div class="grid grid--1to3">
  <div class="grid__column”>
    <!— content goes here —>
  </div>
  <div class="grid__column”>
    <!— content goes here —>
  </div>
  <div class="grid__column”>
    <!— content goes here —>
  </div>
</div>

 

4 columns 

<div class="grid grid--1to4">
  <div class="grid__column”>
    <!— content goes here —>
  </div>
  <div class="grid__column”>
    <!— content goes here —>
  </div>
  <div class="grid__column”>
    <!— content goes here —>
  </div>
  <div class="grid__column”>
    <!— content goes here —>
  </div>
</div>

 

The template is made up various blocks and components that can be rearranged, multiplied into several different looks.

 

Navigation

Banners

Content

Singles

Albums

sections.title: CSS Structure
sections.content:
These are the css files included in the Template

 

    <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/stylesheet.css">

    <!-- Theme Color -->
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/colors/gold.css">

    <!-- More Theme Color Options 
      <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/colors/blue.css">
      <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/colors/brown.css">
      <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/colors/dark-blue.css">
      <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/colors/green.css">
      <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/colors/orange.css">
      <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/colors/pink.css">
      <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/colors/purple.css">
      <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/colors/red.css">
      <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/colors/turquoise.css">
    -->
 
If you would like to quickly change your theme's default gold color. replace the "css/colors/gold.css" file with one of the preset colors below it.
 
 

+ Google Web Fonts

By default the theme loads Oswald, Permanent Marker, PT Sans Narrow, Merriweather, Abril Fatface and Work Sans

 

Feel free to substitute with your own font.

sections.title: Javascript Structure
sections.content:
These are the javascript files that are included just before the closing body tag at the bottom of each page. Each file is necessary for the theme to work correctly so do not remove. 

 

<script src="js/vendor/modernizr-2.8.3.js"></script>
<script src="js/vendor/jquery-1.10.1.min.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript" src="js/plugins/jplayer/jplayer/jquery.jplayer.min.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript" src="js/plugins/jplayer/add-on/jplayer.playlist.min.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript" src="js/audio.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript" src="js/main.js"></script>

sections.title: Tutorial
sections.content:
Creating a single audio track

<!-- single item -->
<div class="grid__column block-thumb">
  <img class="media__artwork u-border" src="images/your-artwork-file.png" />
  <div class="b-text">
    <div class="js-action">
      <div class="js-play" data-title="Test" data-url="http://yoursite.com/path-to-your-file.mp3">
        <div class="js-state-of-track"></div>
        <i class="button--media fa fa-play-circle"></i>
        <div class="media__title">Song Name</div>
        <div class="media__time">2:20</div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
<!-- / single item -->

To replace the audio, find the "data-title" attribute and change it to your song title.
Next, find the "data-url' attribute and change the attribute to match the file path to your .mp3 file. You must include the absolute url to the audio file and the audio file must be a .mp3 file to work.

 

Create a track in an album

<li class="js-action">
  <div class="js-play-album media__playlist-item" data-title="Song Title 1" data-url="http://brettmcdade.com/your-audio-file.mp3">
    <div class="js-state-of-track"></div>
    <div class="playlist-number">01</div>
    <div class="playlist-title">Song Name</div>
    <div class="playlist-time">2:20</div>
  </div>
</li>

Again, repace the data-title and data-url attributes with you audio file's corresponding track title and the file path to the audio file.

 

Video

In the video.html file and the social media content section on the homepage you will see that you have the option of creating a youtube or vimeo popup.

In the social media mash up section find the following code:

<!-- / vimeo -->
<div class="social-mash__tile social-mash__tile--yt">
  <div class="social-mash__content" style="background-image:url('images/fpo_vimeo001.jpg');">
    <div class="hover-overlay"></div>
    <i class="fa fa-play-circle js-play-video" data-source="vimeo" data-id="113208130"></i>
  </div>
</div>
<!-- / vimeo -->

To create a vimeo popup the data-source attribute should be "vimeo". To create a YouTube video, simply change to "youtube". The data-id attribute should match the video id of the file as it's found on YouTube or Vimeo.

 

In the video.html file. Look for the same two data attributes:

<!-- video item -->
<div class="grid__column media__block">
  <div class="media__thumb js-play-video" data-source="youtube" data-id="jYdaQJzcAcw">
    <div class="hover-overlay"></div>
    <img class="" src="images/fpo_video-thumb.png" />
    <i class="fa fa-play-circle js-play-video"></i>
  </div>
  <div class="b-text">
    <div class="media__title">Long Song Name Would Look Like This</div>
    <div class="media__time">2:20</div>
  </div>
</div>
<!-- / video item -->
